column4: hi all i am trying to build boost from source does someone have a how to or a link
any reason to build from source?
boost C libraries right?
it's buggy, what do you mean?
if it's less than 4 lines, otherwise pastebin
if you find a bug it would be helpful to submit a bug report to LaunchPad so we can either Sync the new version of boost or backport a patch to the current one.
do you have libboost-thread-dev?
sudo apt-get install libboost-thread-dev
ok, pkgconfig var might be set wrong
try "PKG_CONFIG=/usr/lib/pkgconfig/ ./configure"
there's probably an error or warning before that?
http://packages.ubuntu.com/cgi-bin/search_contents.pl?word=bits%2Fatomicity.h&searchmode=searchfiles&case=insensitive&version=feisty&arch=i386
it looks like you want to install "build-essential" (try that first), or "libstdc++6-dev"
